node.title: Kazakhstan Says Order Is ‘Mainly Restored’ After Protests
node.alt: The building that houses the mayor’s office was torched on Thursday during protests in Almaty, the biggest city in Kazakhstan.
node.description: Russian troops are on the ground to help the government quell widespread unrest in the country, which had been viewed as a bastion of stability in a volatile region.
node.content: ["BISHKEK, Uzbekistan \u2014 After two days of chaos and violence marked by looting and raging gun battles, the government of Kazakhstan said on Friday that order had been \u201cmainly restored\u201d across the country as Russian troops joined with the country\u2019s security forces to quell widespread unrest.", "President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev released a statement through his office blaming foreign trained \u201cterrorists\u201d for the unrest and vowed to continue security operations until \u201cthe militants are completely eliminated.\u201d", "\u201cWe hear calls from abroad for the parties to negotiate to find a peaceful solution to the problems. This is just nonsense,\u201d Mr. Tokayev said in an address to the nation on Friday.", "\u201cWhat negotiations can there be with criminals and murderers,\u201d he said. \u201cThey need to be destroyed and this will be done.\u201d", "Since the protests turned violent, it has been very hard to assess the events unfolding in the country. Internet and telephone service have been sporadic and there are few reliable independent news outlets in the country. People reached by phone have been largely confined to their homes, hunkering down as explosions rattle the walls.", "Russian troops, operating alongside Kazakh law enforcement agencies, said on Friday they regained full control of the airport in Almaty, the country\u2019s largest city, according to the Russian Defense Ministry.", "\u201cThe security of the Consulate General of the Russian Federation located in the city and other important facilities is being ensured,\u201d a spokesman for the ministry, Igor Konashenkov, said as reported by Interfax, a Russian news agency.", "The ferocity of the unrest caught many observers by surprise. The oil-rich Central Asian nation perched on Russia\u2019s southern steppe had been widely viewed as perhaps the most stable country in a volatile region.", "For most the time since it gained independence three decades ago, the country was ruled by one man: Nursultan Nazarbayev. Even after he formally stepped down as president, he retained the title \u201cleader of the nation\u201d and he was widely viewed as keeping control over the state through his role as chair of the national security council.", "In the wake of the unrest, Mr. Tokayev has publicly assumed control of the security forces and sidelined the 81-year-old autocrat. He also reached out to Moscow for help as popular protests spiraled out of control.", "The Russian-led effort to quell the unrest, described as a temporary peacekeeping mission by a military alliance that is Russia\u2019s equivalent of NATO, will be limited in time and will aim at protecting government buildings and military facilities, Kazakh officials said.", "The alliance, called the Collective Security Treaty Organization, has dispatched about 2,500 troops to Kazakhstan, and that figure could rise, according to the Russian state news agency RIA Novosti.", "This is the first time in the history of the alliance that its protection clause has been invoked.", "Even as Russian paratroopers from the elite 45th Spetsnaz brigade landed in Almaty, gun battles raged on the street and gunfire echoed through the streets late into the night, according to video from a BBC correspondent on the scene.", "The Biden administration is closely watching Moscow\u2019s military intervention in Kazakhstan, a former Soviet republic that Washington has cultivated as a friendly partner.", "The bond has formed in large part because of the major energy investments by American corporations and the cooperation of the former Kazakh president, Mr. Nazarbayev, with the United States on nuclear nonproliferation. Mr. Nazarbayev also supported the American military interventions in Iraq and Afghanistan.", "U.S. officials see Russian President Vladimir V. Putin\u2019s response to the crisis as a test of his ability and determination to maintain a Russian sphere of influence in neighboring countries.", "\u201cThe United States and, frankly, the world will be watching for any violation of human rights,\u201d a State Department spokesman said. \u201cWe will also be watching for any actions that may lay the predicate for the seizure of Kazakh institutions.\u201d", "While the protests started on Sunday with what appeared to be a genuine outpouring of public anger over an increase in fuel prices and broader frustration over a government widely viewed as corrupt \u2014 with vast oil riches benefiting an elite few at the expense of the masses.", "In a concession, the government on Thursday announced a 180-price cap on vehicle fuel and a halt to increases in utility bills.", "However, as the protests swelled, both the government even some supporters of the protests said they had been co-opted by criminal gangs looking to exploit the situation.", "The massive destruction of public property \u2014 including the torching of Almaty\u2019s City Hall and the burning and looting of scores of other government buildings \u2014 has been met with a strong show of force by security personal.", "The interior ministry in a statement on Friday said 26 \u201carmed criminals\u201d had been \u201cliquidated\u201d and 18 security officers killed in the unrest."]
